subLabel.preValidation: Provide naming prefix values for all Azure resources that will be created.

options.text: Tenant level deployments require access at the tenant root (/) scope. Visit this link to ensure you have the appropriate RBAC permission to complete the deployment
The deployment will create the management group hierarchy under the Tenant Root Group with the prefix provided at this step.

elements.name: esComIdentifier
elements.label: Company Identifier Prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the company identifier, 1-5 characters.

elements.name: esLocIdentifier
elements.label: Location Identifier Prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the location identifier, 3 characters (Australia East - SYD) or (Australia SouthEast - MEL)

elements.name: esPlatformMgmtIdentifier
elements.label: Platform Management Subscription Identifier Prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Platform Management Subscription Identifier.

elements.name: esPlatformIdamIdentifier
elements.label: Platform Identity Subscription Identifier Prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Platform Identity Subscription Identifier.

elements.name: esPlatformConnIdentifier
elements.label: Platform Connectivity Subscription Identifier Prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Platform Connectivity Subscription Identifier.

options.text: Please provide Azure resource naming values:

elements.name: esArgIdentifier
elements.label: Resource Group Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Resource Group identifier

elements.name: esOmsIdentifier
elements.label: Log Analytics Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a naming prefix for the Log Analytics workspace identifier

elements.name: esVngIdentifier
elements.label: Virtual Network Gateway Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a naming prefix for the Virtual Network Gateway identifier

elements.name: esVntIdentifier
elements.label: Virtual Network Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Virtual Network identifier

elements.name: esPipIdentifier
elements.label: Public IP Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a naming prefix for the Public IP identifier

elements.name: esAfwIdentifier
elements.label: Azure Firewall Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a naming prefix for the Azure Firewall identifier

elements.name: esAaaIdentifier
elements.label: Azure Automation Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a naming prefix for the Azure Automation identifier

elements.name: esStaIdentifier
elements.label: Storage Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Storage identifier

elements.name: esUdrIdentifier
elements.label: Route Table Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Route Table identifier

elements.name: esNsgIdentifier
elements.label: Network Security Group Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Network Security Group identifier

elements.name: esAkvIdentifier
elements.label: Azure Key Vault Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Azure Key Vault Identifier

elements.name: esRsvIdentifier
elements.label: Recovery Services Vaults Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Recovery Services Vaults Identifier

elements.name: esBasIdentifier
elements.label: Azure Bastion Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Azure Bastion Identifier

elements.name: esDdosIdentifier
elements.label: Azure DDoS Protection Identifier
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Azure DDoS Protection Identifier

options.text: Please provide values for the Landing Zone tags:

elements.name: esSubscriptionTag
elements.label: Subscription Tag
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the subscription tag

elements.name: esOwnerTag
elements.label: Owner Tag
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the owner tag

elements.name: esCostCenterTag
elements.label: Cost Center Tag
elements.toolTip: Provide a value for the Cost Center tag

options.text: To enable the Platform Subscription, you must choose an Azure subscription. This subscription will be moved to the Platform Management Group and associated Platform resources will be deployed.

elements.name: esLogAnalytics
elements.label: Deploy Log Analytics Workspace
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when adding an Azure Subscription, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance.

elements.name: esLogRetention
elements.label: Log Analytics Data Retention (days)
elements.toolTip: Select retention days for Azure logs. Default is 30 days.

options.text: Select which Azure Monitor solutions to enable for the Log Analytics Workspace

elements.name: esAgentSolution
elements.label: Deploy Agent Health solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esChangeTracking
elements.label: Deploy Change Tracking solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esUpdateMgmt
elements.label: Deploy Update Management solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esActivityLog
elements.label: Deploy Activity Log solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esVmInsights
elements.label: Deploy VM Insights solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esAntiMalware
elements.label: Deploy Anti-malware solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esServiceMap
elements.label: Deploy Service Map solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esSqlAssessment
elements.label: Deploy SQL Assessment solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esKeyVaultAnalytics
elements.label: Deploy Key Vault Analytics solution
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

options.text: Select which Azure Security solutions to enable.

elements.name: esAsc
elements.label: Deploy Azure Security Center and enable security monitoring for the Platform and resources
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esAscEmailContact
elements.label: Azure Security Center Email Contact
elements.toolTip: Provide the email contact for Azure Security Center alerts

constraints.validationMessage: Please provide a valid email address

elements.name: esAscVms
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for Servers
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for all servers.

elements.name: esAscApps
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for AppServices
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for AppServices.

elements.name: esAscStorage
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for Storage
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for Storage.

elements.name: esAscSql
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for SQL
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for SQL.

elements.name: esAscSqlOnVm
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for SQL servers on machines
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for SQL servers on machines.

elements.name: esAscKeyVault
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for Key Vault
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for Key Vault.

elements.name: esAscArm
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for Azure Resource Manager
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for Resource Manager.

elements.name: esAscDns
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for DNS
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for DNS.

elements.name: esAscKubernetes
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for Kubernetes
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for Kubernetes.

elements.name: esAscRegistries
elements.label: Enable Azure Defender for Container registries
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Defender will be enabled for Container registries.

elements.name: esSecuritySolution
elements.label: Deploy Azure Sentinel
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esSta
elements.label: Deploy a Storage account for diagnostics.
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a Storage account will be deployed

elements.name: esActivityLogSta
elements.label: Enable Long Term retention of Logs to Azure Storage.
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Long term retention of Azure Activity Logs to Azure Storage will be enabled

options.text: Azure Foundations provides an integrated CI/CD pipeline via AzOps that can be used with either GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps pipelines.

Azure Foundations provides an integrated CI/CD pipeline via AzOps that can be used with either GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps pipelines, but requires a dedicated subscription for platform management in the previous step. Please add a subscription or continue without setting up the CI/CD integration.
Provide the credentials to initialize the repository with the ARM templates for Enterprise-Scale.

elements.name: optionsGroup1
elements.label: Select CI/CD option
elements.toolTip: Azure Foundations will provide options for both GitHub Actions and Azure DevOps pipelines. For now, only GitHub Actions is available

elements.name: esGit
elements.label: GitHub organization or username
elements.toolTip: Provide Git org/username.

constraints.validationMessage: The GitHub org/username must be 1-39 characters.

elements.name: esGitRepoName
elements.label: New GitHub repository name
elements.toolTip: Provide a name for the new repository that will be created

constraints.validationMessage: The repository name must be 1-100 characters.

elements.name: esPaToken
elements.toolTip: Provide the personal access token to access your GitHub account or organization. For more information see this link: https://docs.github.com/en/github/authenticating-to-github/creating-a-personal-access-token

constraints.validationMessage: Password must be at least 8 characters long, contain only numbers and letters

toolTip.password: Provide the application secret as it will be used to authenticate with Azure AD

options.text: Azure Foundations enables hybrid network connectivity with an on-premises environment using the Hub & Spoke network topology. Please note, all network connectivity components will be deployed to the Platform Subscription.

elements.name: esHub
elements.label: Deploy Virtual Hub
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy a Virtual Network Hub

elements.name: esAddress
elements.label: Address space (required for Virtual Hub)
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g. 10.49.0.0/18)

constraints.validationMessage: Virtual network's address space, specified as a CIDR notation (e.g. 10.49.0.0/18)

elements.name: esNwLocation
elements.label: Region for the first virtual hub
elements.toolTip: Select the target Azure region for the deployment.

elements.name: esDdoS
elements.label: Enable DDoS Protection Standard
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a platform subscription, DDoS Protection Standard will be enabled.

elements.name: esEnablePrivateDnsZones
elements.label: Deploy Azure Private DNS Zones
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Private DNS Zones will be deployed.

elements.name: esEnablePrivateDnsZoneBlob
elements.label: Deploy Private DNS (Blob Storage)
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then the Azure Private DNS Zone will be deployed.

elements.name: esEnablePrivateDnsZoneAkv
elements.label: Deploy Private DNS (Key Vault)
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then the Azure Private DNS Zone will be deployed.

elements.name: esEnablePrivateDnsZoneFiles
elements.label: Deploy Private DNS (File Storage)
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then the Azure Private DNS Zone will be deployed.

elements.name: esEnablePrivateDnsZoneQueue
elements.label: Deploy Private DNS (Queue Storage)
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then the Azure Private DNS Zone will be deployed.

elements.name: esEnablePrivateDnsZoneTable
elements.label: Deploy Private DNS (Table Storage)
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then the Azure Private DNS Zone will be deployed.

elements.name: esVpnGw
elements.label: Deploy VPN Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, ARM will deploy VPN gateway

elements.name: esGwRegionalOrAz
elements.label: Deploy zone redundant or regional VPN Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Virtual Gateway to the selected region and availability zones.

elements.name: esGwNoAzSku
elements.label: Select the VPN Gateway SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the required SKU for the VPN gateway.

allowedValues.label: VpnGw2
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 500 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 1.25 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw3
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 1000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 2.5 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw4
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 5000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 5 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw5
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 10000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 10 Gbps

elements.name: esGwAzSku
elements.label: Select the VPN Gateway SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the required SKU for the VPN gateway.

allowedValues.label: VpnGw2AZ
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 500 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 1.25 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw3AZ
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 1000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 2.5 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw4AZ
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 5000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 5 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw5AZ
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 10000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 10 Gbps

elements.name: esGwRegionalSku
elements.label: Select the VPN Gateway SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the required SKU for the VPN gateway.

allowedValues.label: VpnGw2
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 500 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 1.25 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw3
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 1000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 2.5 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw4
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 5000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 5 Gbps

allowedValues.label: VpnGw5
allowedValues.description: Supports BGP, max 30 S2S/VNet-VNet tunnels, max 128 P2S SSTP connections, max 10000 IKEv2/OpenVPN connections, aggregate throughput is 10 Gbps

elements.name: esAddressVpnOrEr
elements.label: Subnet for VPN/ExpressRoute Gateway
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 10.100.1.0/24)

constraints.validationMessage: The subnet network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esErGw
elements.label: Deploy ExpressRoute Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, ARM will deploy an ExpressRoute gateway

elements.name: esErRegionalOrAz
elements.label: Deploy zone redundant or regional ExpressRoute Gateway
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Express Route Gateway to the selected region and availability zones.

elements.name: esErAzSku
elements.label: Select the ExpressRoute Gateway SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the required SKU for the Express Route gateway.

allowedValues.label: ErGw1AZ
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 1000, packets per second 100,000, connections per second 7000, max number of cicuit connections is 4

allowedValues.label: ErGw2AZ
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 2000, packets per second 250,000, connections per second 14000, max number of cicuit connections is 8

allowedValues.label: ErGw3AZ
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 10,000, packets per second 1,000,000, connections per second 28,000, max number of cicuit connections is 16

elements.name: esErRegionalSku
elements.label: Select the ExpressRoute Gateway SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the required SKU for the Express Route gateway.

allowedValues.label: Standard
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 1000, packets per second 100,000, connections per second 7000, max number of cicuit connections is 4

allowedValues.label: HighPerformance
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 2000, packets per second 250,000, connections per second 14000, max number of cicuit connections is 8

allowedValues.label: UltraPerformance
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 10,000, packets per second 1,000,000, connections per second 28,000, max number of cicuit connections is 16

elements.name: esErNoAzSku
elements.label: Select the ExpressRoute Gateway SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the required SKU for the Express Route gateway.

allowedValues.label: Standard
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 1000, packets per second 100,000, connections per second 7000, max number of cicuit connections is 4

allowedValues.label: HighPerformance
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 2000, packets per second 250,000, connections per second 14000, max number of cicuit connections is 8

allowedValues.label: UltraPerformance
allowedValues.description: Megabits per second 10,000, packets per second 1,000,000, connections per second 28,000, max number of cicuit connections is 16

elements.name: esAzFw
elements.label: Deploy Azure Firewall
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, an Azure Firewall will be deployed.

elements.name: esAzFwDns
elements.label: Enable Azure Firewall as a DNS proxy
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will enable Azure Firewall as a DNS Proxy.

elements.name: esFwAz
elements.label: Select Availability Zones for the Azure Firewall
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will deploy Azure Firewall to the selected region and availability zones.

elements.name: esAddressFw
elements.label: Subnet for Azure Firewall
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 10.100.0.0/24)

constraints.validationMessage: The subnet network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esAzBastion
elements.label: Deploy Azure Bastion
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, an Azure Bastion will be deployed.

elements.name: esAddressBastion
elements.label: Subnet for Azure Bastion
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 10.100.0.0/24)

constraints.validationMessage: The subnet network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esAppGw
elements.label: Deploy Azure App Gateway Subnet
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a subnet for App Gateways will be deployed.

elements.name: esAddressAppGw
elements.label: Subnet for Azure App gateways
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 10.100.0.0/24)

constraints.validationMessage: The subnet network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

options.text: To enable identity (AuthN/AuthZ) for workloads in landing zones, you must allocate an identity Subscription that is dedicated to host your Active Directory domain controllers. Please note, this Subscription will be moved to the identity Management Group, and ARM will assign the selected policies. We recommend using a new Subscription with no existing resources.

elements.name: esIdentity
elements.label: Enable identity subscription
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for connectivity, ARM will move selected subscription into identity management group

options.text: Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your identity management group.

elements.name: esIdDenyRdp
elements.label: Prevent inbound RDP from internet
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound RDP from internet

elements.name: esIdDenySubnetNsg
elements.label: Ensure subnets are associated with NSG
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure NSGs must be associated with subnets being created

elements.name: esIdDenyPublicIp
elements.label: Prevent usage of public IP
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure public IP resources cannot be created

elements.name: esIdAzBackup
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are enabled for Azure Backup
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.

elements.name: esRsv
elements.label: Deploy a Recovery Services Vault.
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a Recovery Services Vault will be deployed

options.text: You can optionally provide subscriptions for your first landing zones for both 'online' and 'corp' and assign recommended policies that will ensure workloads will be secure, monitored, and protected according to best practices.
Select the subscriptions you want to move to corp management group.

elements.name: esLzConnectivity
elements.label: Connect corp landing zones to the connectivity hub (optional)?
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected for corp landing zones, ARM will connect the subscriptions to the hub virtual network via VNet peering.

elements.name: lzConnectedSubs
elements.ariaLabel: Add existing subscriptions into the management group landing zone and provide address space for virtual network peering
elements.label: Corp connected landing zone subscriptions (optional)

element.placeholder: Ensure there are no overlapping IP addresses!

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

options.text: Select the subscriptions you want to move to online management group.
Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your landing zones.

elements.name: esSqlAudit
elements.label: Ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQL
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQL

elements.name: esAksPolicy
elements.label: Enable Kubernetes (AKS) for Azure Policy
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esAksPriv
elements.label: Prevent privileged containers in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged containers in AKS

elements.name: esAksNoPriv
elements.label: Prevent privileged escalation in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged escalations in AKS

elements.name: esAksIngress
elements.label: Ensure HTTPS ingress is enforced in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, HTTPS ingress will be required in AKS

elements.name: esSqlEncryption
elements.label: Ensure Azure SQL is enabled with transparent data encryption
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esDenyPip
elements.label: Prevent Public IP Addresses
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent Public IP Addresses

elements.name: esDenyRdp
elements.label: Prevent inbound RDP from internet
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound RDP from internet

elements.name: esHttpsStorage
elements.label: Ensure secure connections (HTTPS) to storage accounts
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure storage can only be accessed using HTTPS

elements.name: esIpForwarding
elements.label: Prevent IP forwarding
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent IP forwarding

elements.name: esNsg
elements.label: Ensure subnets are associated with NSG
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure Network Security Groups must be associated with subnets being created

elements.name: esDenySsh
elements.label: Prevent inbound SSH from internet
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound SSH from internet

elements.name: esLzPrivateLink
elements.label: Prevent usage of Public Endpoints for PaaS services in the corp connected landing zones
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent PaaS resources to use public endpoints.

elements.name: esEncryptionInTransit
elements.label: Ensure encryption in transit is enabled for PaaS services
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will ensure PaaS resources uses TLS and SSL.

elements.name: esDenyPrivateDnsZones
elements.label: Prevent usage of Azure Private DNS Zones in the corp connected landing zones
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected then Azure Policy will prevent creation of Azure Private DNS Zones

elements.name: esVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esVmssMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMSS (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance

elements.name: esArcVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure Arc VMs (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continuous compliance
